channel.title: Good homework help at popular Q/A websites
channel.description:
Have you heard of [url=http://answers.yahoo.com]Yahoo! Answers[/url]? It's an amazing subsidiary of Yahoo! that has a point system which gives helpful people another incentive to answer questions for free. I post my calculus, chemistry, and electrical engineering questions and most, if not, all are answered. When you post, just be perfectly clear in what you're asking. If you're asking a math question with fractions, don't forget to use parenthesis or if you have to, draw out the picture and link to it in your question.
I'm somewhat active in the math and chem sections mainly because it helps me with my studies when I help others. :)
~Ron

item.title: Good homework help at popular Q/A websites
item.dc:creator: @Man_UTD_Freak Man UTD Freak
item.description:
@Man_UTD_Freak wrote:

Wiki Answers is by far not as good, but if you don’t find an answer to your question on Yahoo then it’s worth a try posting the question on Wiki Answers.

Link: http://wiki.answers.com/

Read full topic
item.source: Good homework help at popular Q/A websites
